alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:22PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Etowah and Cherokee Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 222 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tabor Road, or 14 miles east of Boaz, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Forney, Centre Municipal Airport, Glencoe, Sardis City, Leesburg, Altoona, Walnut Grove, Reece City, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Cherokee Rock Village, Aurora and Pleasant Gap. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.
